title: 462-A
statement: A. Appleman and Easy Tasktime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutToastman came up with a very easy task. He gives it to Appleman, but Appleman doesn't know how to solve it. Can you help him?Given an×ncheckerboard. Each cell of the board has either character 'x', or character 'o'. Is it true that each cell of the board has even number of adjacent cells with 'o'? Two cells of the board are adjacent if they share a side.InputThe first line contains an integern(1 ≤n≤ 100). Thennlines follow containing the description of the checkerboard. Each of them containsncharacters (either 'x' or 'o') without spaces.OutputPrint "YES" or "NO" (without the quotes) depending on the answer to the problem.ExamplesInput3xxoxoxoxxOutputYESInput4xxxoxoxooxoxxxxxOutputNO

processed.result:
Given a checkerboard of size $n \times n$, where each cell contains either 'x' or 'o'.  Determine if every cell on the checkerboard has an even number of adjacent cells containing 'o'. Two cells are adjacent if they share a side. 

Output "YES" if this condition is true for all cells, otherwise output "NO".
Given a grid of 'x's and 'o's, determine if each cell has an even number of 'o's directly next to it.
